text: Options give you the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an underlying asset at a specific price before a certain date. Call options give you the right to buy, while put options give you the right to sell.

The strike price is the price at which an option contract can be exercised. For call options, if the market price exceeds the strike price, the option is 'in the money'. For put options, it's the opposite.
Options contracts have expiration dates. After this date, the contract is no longer valid. Weekly options expire every Friday, while monthly options typically expire on the third Friday of the month.
